subject: Adds SSL configuration params to the client

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message:
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Looks great, nice work.

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Normally when I see SSL client support I see options for 3 things:

1) a client key
2) a client cert
3) a CA cert

Is there a reason we aren't supporting the CA certs for Glance SSL? Am I missing something?

Patch Set 1:

Hey Dan, to be honest, I'm not an expert on SSL stuff and I did my best to figure out what was needed here. I could use your advice. Could you elaborate a bit more on what is needed on the CA part? Thanks much!
-jay

Patch Set 1:

A client key and cert would be used by the Glance client to help negotiate an SSL connection to a Glance Registry server which is performing SSL client auth.

A CA cert would allow the client to verify things up the certificate chain to ensure that it is talking to a trusted server.

If we were trying to support SSL verification both ways I would expect 3 new config parameters: client key, client cert, CA cert (which controls who this client trusts)
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

This looks great, Jay. Found a few things:

Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

fixing up the few issues...
Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks, Jay. Looks good.

Patch Set 3:

So this is looking better.

Jay: one question I have for you is have you functionally tested this out? Have you run a Glance registry server under SSL and then used the Glance client updates in this branch to connect to it. We don't currently have any functional testing/plumbing that is really going to flex this code yet so I'm just wondering if you've given it a go at least once?

Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Looks good to me. Great work here, Jay.

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Functional tests are failing to me ("Failed to start servers") with a fresh venv. They work for you?

Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, well I tried it on another system and it worked fine. I don't want to hold this up any more. I'll look into the failures later.

Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM, nice work here Jay.

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm getting conflicts with glance master:

CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in glance/client.py
Auto-merging glance/common/client.py
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in glance/common/client.py
Auto-merging glance/common/exception.py
Auto-merging glance/registry/__init__.py
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in glance/registry/__init__.py
Auto-merging glance/registry/client.py
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in glance/registry/client.py
Auto-merging glance/tests/unit/test_clients.py
Automatic merge failed; fix conflicts and then commit the result.

Also. My question earlier on this merge prop stands:

Have you kicked the tires on Glance SSL functionally? We don't have a lot of functional tests on it yet so it would be nice to know if at least one person has verified this code actually works.

Patch Set 4:

Hey Dan, I will rebase with master shortly.

As for functionally testing Glance with SSL, HP engineers have done some, yes. However, I would really appreciate some assistance from those who know SSL better to come up with ways to easily test SSL connections (client and server) with self-signed certs that are generated on the fly by the functional test case. Any and all help would be really appreciated!
-jay
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 4:

rebased and resolved conflicts. all tests passing for me locally.

Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hey Jay,

Couple more things:

---

See my comments from Aug 10th. I'd still like to consider adding a 'ca_cert option' so that the client can validate it is talking to a trusted server? What we've currently got will allow the server to verify its talking to a trusted client but not the opposite.

---

I'd also prefer to use:

  registry_client_protocol=https

instead of:

  registry_client_use_ssl=True
Uploaded patch set 6.

Patch Set 6: (6 inline comments)

Mostly looks OK to me.  I noticed several places where _() vanished, though.  There was also one doc comment that was a little confusing, but hardly a blocker.

Patch Set 6:

Good catches, Kevin. I'll clean those up. This branch was started before i18n, so was just me messing up the conflict resolution :)

Patch Set 7:

Kevin, fixed up those i18n's for ya.

Dan, I added the ca_file stuff you had asked for. I'd appreciate another test of this branch.

Thanks much!
-jay
